name: Black
overview: Black is played on a board divided into squares. Players take turns filling the squares with tiles that are marked with pathways. There are three different tile designs to choose from. After each turn, a marker (represented by a heart symbol) begins travelling down the vertical pathway in the top left square, and continues until it comes to a blank square. This blank square is the next one the player must fill. Play continues until 1 player loses by making the marker go off the board, or by making it go into the bottom right square (marked by a *). This game was developed and published by Island Software in 1983.
